ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A course that teaches a student to rid themselves of the notion that "the book is always better" insofar as we learn that the adaptation process is ever more delicate and nuanced than expected.
I would recommend the class for anyone; I think that analysis of adaptation gives great insight about literature, film, history, etc.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course introduced me to many films-- and filmmakers-- I had not encountered before, and also allowed me to make connections of influence that allow me to understand modernliterature a bit more.
The class gave me a better sense of some canonical works, and deepened my understanding of the interaction of various media.
